pr_title: Check the size of vcr node list before finding one to assign as cloud peer.

timeline.author: lightningrob

timeline.bodyText: No need to log if the same message is passed to exception.  Also say VCR.
timeline.author: lightningrob

timeline.bodyText: I realize this isn't new code, but it seems inefficient for a getter method to have to copy a collection to an array every time it needs to get an element from it.  It makes me wonder if the concurrent set is really the optimal data structure for this.
timeline.author: lightningrob

replies.bodyText: It's fine to address last comment in a future PR.
replies.author: lightningrob

replies.bodyText: You are right. It makes sense to make it a list. We modify it only in the CloudToStoreReplicationManager::handleChangeInVcrNodes() method and access it only in the CloudToStoreReplicationManager::getCloudDataNode(). And it makes sense to modify the atomic reference directly.  Have made the change.
replies.author: ankagrawal

timeline.message:
Make list of vcr nodes a list instead of set.
Address review comments.

timeline.bodyText: I didn't notice it before, but I think initializing a new Random() each time will result in the same value each time.  At least that's how it used to behave, not sure if it's still the case.  Either way, I would initialize the Random statically and reuse.  I recommend adding a test case that calls this method consecutive times and verifies different results are returned.  And one to test the no-nodes exception case.
timeline.author: lightningrob
